intro: Fimbristylis dallachyi, commonly known as the slender flatsedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded areas, such as marshes and swampy soils. The plant has slender, grass-like stems with narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are arranged in spikelets, which are typically borne in dense clusters at the base of the plant. Fimbristylis dallachyi is adapted to aquatic or semi-aquatic environments and plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils.
